alert.note: Alert for Washington (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 10:16PM PST until December 29 at 1:41AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Marys River near Philomath affecting Benton County. Tualatin River near Dilley affecting Washington County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tualatin River near Dilley. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Above 17.5 feet, several minor roads begin to flood and may be closed. Widespread lowland agricultural flooding occurs at this and higher stages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is currently cresting and will gradually subside over the next 24 hours. The river may remain above flood stage through either late Wednesday or early Thursday. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 1000 AM PST Wednesday.
